in natural state, used as pillow Ge 28:11, Ge 28:18 (E); seat Ex 17:12 (E); cover of well Ge 29:2, Ge 29:3, Ge 29:3, Ge 29:8, Ge 29:10 (J); causing one to stumble Is 8:14; marring good ground 2Ki 3:19, 2Ki 3:25; hand-missle Ex 21:18 (JE) Nu 35:17, Nu 35:23 (P) 2Sa 16:6, 2Sa 16:13, esp. in judicial stoning, with vb. [[רׂאשׁ פִּנׇּה]] Ps 118:22 as above), Zec 3:9 upon one stone seven eyes, prob. refers to this cap- or head-stone; the eyes are symbol of God's watchfulness; perhaps explaining cup-stones found in Orient, v. stones containing metal, = ore, De 8:9 (v. Di) Job 28:2 cf. v:Job 28:3. †

a weight, orig. stone (v. Pr 27:3 cf. Eng. weight stone = 14 lb) [[אַבְנֵי־כִיס]] Pr 16:11 (cf. As. Dl:W 38); [[הַמֶּלֶח]] ´[[א]] 2Sa 14:26 (i.e. acc. to royal standard; cf. COT:Ge 23:16); ´[[וׇא]] ´[[א]] De 25:13, Pr 20:10, Pr 20:23 (i.e. different weights, for dishonest use); [[כִּיס אַבְנֵי מִרְמָה]] Mic 6:11; just weights [[אַבְנֵי־חֶדֶק]] Le 19:36; [[שְׁלֵמָה]] ´[[א]] Pr 11:1; hence also heavy mass of metal (lead) Zec 5:8. †

objects like stones; partic. hail, explicitly, [[אַבְנֵי הַבָּרָד]] Jos 10:11 cf. Is 30:30; [[אֶלְגׇּבִישׁ]] ´[[א]] Ez Eze 13:11, Eze 13:18, Eze 38:22; but also [[אֲבָנִים]] [[גְּדׂלוֹת]] Jos 10:11 (E) (cf. As. Dl:W 38); lime-stones [[אַבְנֵי־גִר]] Is 27:9.

in sim. (mostly poet.) of sinking in water Ex 15:5 = Ne 9:11; motionlessness Ex 15:16; strength Job 6:12; firmness Job 41:16; solidity (of ice) Job 38:30; in prose, of commonness 1Ki 10:27, 2Ch 1:15; also metaph. of one in fear 1Sa 25:37 (i.e. petrified with terror, cf. Ex 15:16 supr.); ´[[לֵב הָא]] = perverse, hard heart Ez Eze 11:19, Eze 36:26; [[אַבְנֵי־נֵזֶר]] Zec 9:16 (of ransomed Isr.)—´[[א]] personif. Hb Hab 2:11 cf. v:Hab 2:19; cf. Ez Eze 13:11 (v.
